org.fujion.common

Class JSONUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.common.JSONUtil

  • public class JSONUtil
extends Object
    A set of static methods supporting serialization and deserialization of objects using the JSON format. This particular implementation uses the Jackson JSON library, but other JSON implementations could be used.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  JSONUtil.AsPropertyTypeSerializerEx
      Required to suppress writing of type information except for top-level objects.

      • registerAlias

        public static void registerAlias(String alias,
                                 Class<?> clazz)
        Register an alias for the specified class. The alias will be used when serializing objects of this class. A given class or alias may only be registered once.
        Parameters:
        alias - Alias to be used for serialization.
        clazz - Class to be associated with the alias.

      • unregisterAlias

      • merge

        public static com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode merge(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode destNode,
                                                            com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode srcNode)
        Merges one JSON tree (srcNode) into another (destNode).
        Parameters:
        destNode - The tree receiving the merged node.
        srcNode - The tree supplying the nodes to merge.
        Returns:
        The destination node post merging.

      • merge

        public static com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode merge(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode destNode,
                                                            com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode srcNode,
                                                            boolean deleteOnNull)
        Merges one JSON tree (srcNode) into another (destNode).
        Parameters:
        destNode - The tree receiving the merged node.
        srcNode - The tree supplying the nodes to merge.
        deleteOnNull - If true and a null value is encountered in the source, delete the corresponding node in the destination. If false, null values are treated like any other value.
        Returns:
        The destination node post merging.
